author: dsolodow
body:
Followed steps here:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/install/installing-powershell-core-on-linux?view=powershell-7.1#ubuntu-2004

Received:
user@localhost ~> sudo apt-get install powershell
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
Package powershell is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source

E: Package 'powershell' has no installation candidate

comments.author: Izzmo
comments.body:
Same issue here, except mine says

> E: Unable to locate package powershell

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body: I believe team members are currently working on this.

comments.author: dsolodow
comments.body: Package is now available in the repo.

title: Ubuntu 20.04 - No Installation candidate
